intro: Monotaxis grandiflora var. minor, commonly known as the lesser broad-leafed monocot, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy, often colorful inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its flowers are usually arranged in spikes or clusters and can bloom throughout the growing season. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
